column1: 0B6A2F00-CA12-4DFA-8434-4E6465254D8A#appfire#D8986D3B-67AE-4547-9BB4-84B6A064C63A#appfire#refresh.frequency#appfire#0#appfire#Refresh Time to reload this configuration file In a production environment
column2: if you want to debug a specific component you can change the Alarm Log Levels (for specific Target like File
column3: DB etc) of that specific components. Once the configuration is refreshed new Log Events will be written to the configured Target (File
column4: DB etc). This will help to isolate and troubleshoot a production environment without shutting down the application. #appfire#Refresh Frequency#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#17AA4BF4-5C70-442D-BA4A-4BD805A5862C#appfire#D8986D3B-67AE-4547-9BB4-84B6A064C63A#appfire#alarm.queue#appfire#0#appfire#Logging Framework is Asynchronous in nature. Log Events goes to the Queue first and connectors takes the event from the queue for processing. Event Queue Type 0 - Circular Queue (RECOMMENDED) 1 - Infinite Queue with Initial Capacity and events will be wrapped in Soft References (JVM will garbage collect these soft references when it runs out of memory). 2 - Infinite Queue (NOT RECOMMENDED)#appfire#Alarm Queue Type#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#1#appfirenewline#C46A6CA5-251E-4F69-9A09-053CB56A86BC#appfire#D8986D3B-67AE-4547-9BB4-84B6A064C63A#appfire#alarm.volume#appfire#100000#appfire##appfire#Alarm Volume#appfire#1#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#\N#appfire#2016-04-19 16:02:17.0#appfire#1
